New Records: Greece secured a 3-0 victory over Finland in their UEFA Nations League match, setting a new record for their highest score in a competitive match
Key Match Events: Fotis Ioannidis scored twice for Greece in the 23rd and 76th minutes
Benjamin Kallman scored an own goal for Finland in the 37th minute
Matti Peltola received a yellow card for a foul late in the match
Pre-Game Insights: Greece entered the match leading their group with two wins and six points
The match was held at Georgios Karaiskakis Stadium in Piraeus, Greece, in front of 17,293 fans
Miscellaneous Highlights: Greece's formation was 4-2-3-1 during the match
Both teams made several substitutions, with Greece having more substitutions than FinlandThe match was the first of the 2024-25 UEFA Nations League Group Stage for both teams
